item.title: Rick add a quote by Julia Child
item.description: "I was 32 when I started cooking; up until then, I just ate." -- Julia Child

item.title: Rick add a quote by H.P. Lovecraft
item.description: "Pleasure to me is wonderâ€”the unexplored, the unexpected, the thing that is hidden and the changeless thing that lurks behind superficial mutability." -- H.P. Lovecraft

item.title: Rick add a quote by Gilles Deleuze
item.description: "A concept is a brick. It can be used to build a courthouse of reason. Or it can be thrown through the window." -- Gilles Deleuze

item.title: Rick add a quote by Francis Bacon
item.description: "Hope is a good breakfast, but it is a bad supper." -- Francis Bacon

item.title: Rick add a quote by H.P. Lovecraft
item.description: "As for the Republicans -- how can one regard seriously a frightened, greedy, nostalgic huddle of tradesmen and lucky idlers who shut their eyes to history and science, steel their emotions against decent human sympathy, cling to sordid and provincial ideals exalting sheer acquisitiveness and condoning artificial hardship for the non-materially-shrewd, dwell smugly and sentimentally in a distorted dream-cosmos of outmoded phrases and principles and attitudes based on the bygone agricultural-handicraft world, and revel in (consciously or unconsciously) mendacious assumptions (such as the notion that real liberty is synonymous with the single detail of unrestricted economic license or that a rational planning of resource-distribution would contravene some vague and mystical 'American heritage'...) utterly contrary to fact and without the slightest foundation in human experience? Intellectually, the Republican idea deserves the tolerance and respect one gives to the dead." -- H.P. Lovecraft

item.title: Rick add a quote by Pierre Boulle
item.description: "There's always some further action to take." -- Pierre Boulle

item.title: Rick add a quote by Sigrid Undset
item.description: "All my days I have longed equally to travel the right road and to take my own errant path." -- Sigrid Undset

item.title: Rick add a quote by Margaret Drabble
item.description: "Perhaps the rare and simple pleasure of being seen for what one is compensates for the misery of being it." -- Margaret Drabble

item.title: Rick add a quote by Aung San Suu Kyi
item.description: "The only real prison is fear, and the only real freedom is freedom from fear" -- Aung San Suu Kyi

item.title: Rick add a quote by Vikram Seth
item.description: "God save us from people who mean well." -- Vikram Seth

item.title: Rick add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "Tonight I can write the saddest lines I loved her, and sometimes she loved me too." -- Pablo Neruda
